content.description: An object with mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is attached to a horizontal ideal spring with spring constant <math alttext="k" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The object is initially at rest at equilibrium where the position <math alttext="x equals 0" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The object is pulled to the right until the spring is stretched to <math alttext="x equals A" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. It is released and allowed to slide across a surface with negligible friction. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, the object is at equilibrium and moving to the left.
content.question: Which of the following is a correct expression for the velocity <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the object as a function of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="v of t equals negative A times the square root of the fraction k over m, end fraction, end root, times cosine of, open parenthesis, the square root of the fraction k over m, end fraction, end root, times t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>A</mi><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt><mi>t</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="v of t equals A times the square root of the fraction k over m, end fraction, end root, times cosine of, open parenthesis, the square root of the fraction k over m, end fraction, end root, times t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt><mi>t</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="v of t equals negative A times the square root of the fraction k over m, end fraction, end root, times sine of, open parenthesis, the square root of the fraction k over m, end fraction, end root, times t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>A</mi><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt><mi>t</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="v of t equals A times the square root of the fraction m over k, end fraction, end root, times sine of, open parenthesis, the square root of the fraction m over k, end fraction, end root, times t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt><mi>t</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
